item.title: Oh No, Too Many Games Are Rushing To Fill The GTA 6-Sized Hole In October
item.content:encoded:
Thereâ€™s a large storm forming on the horizon. This October, around 40 games across all kinds of genres, franchises, and scales are set to launch on every major platform under the sun. Thereâ€™s no escaping it. There are likely at least two games (or more!) in October that youâ€™ll want to play, including stuff like Battlefield 6 and Moonlighter 2. So batten down the hatches and get ready to ride out the video game super storm that is coming in just a few short months.

Hereâ€™s the full list of planned October releases as of August 20:

  • Ghost of Yotei â€“ October 2
  • Gigasword â€“ October 2
  • Neon Inferno â€“ October 2
  • Borderlands 4 on Switch 2 â€“ October 3
  • Digimon Story: Time Stranger â€“ October 3
  • Absolum â€“ October 9
  • Painkiller â€“ October 9
  • Barbie Horse Trails â€“ October 10
  • Battlefield 6 â€“ October 10
  • Little Nightmares 3 â€“ October 10
  • Nascar 25 â€“ October 14
  • Just Dance 2026 â€“ October 14
  • Ball x Pit â€“ October 15
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A â€“ October 16
  • Keeper â€“ October 17
  • The Elf on the Shelf: Christmas Heroes â€“ October 17
  • Escape Simulator 2 â€“ October 21
  • Bloodlines 2 â€“ Oct 21
  • Jurassic World Evolution 3 â€“ October 21
  • Ninja Gaiden 4 â€“ October 21
  • Double Dragon Revive â€“ October 23
  • Moonlighter 2 â€“ Oct 23
  • Plants Vs. Zombies: Replanted â€“ October 23
  • The Crazy Hyper-Dungeon Chronicles â€“ October 23
  • Fast & Furious: Arcade Edition â€“ October 24
  • Once Upon a Katamari â€“ October 24
  • Ire: A Prologue â€“ October 28
  • The Outer Worlds 2 â€“ October 29
  • Arc Raiders â€“ October 30
  • Terminator 2D: No Fate â€“ October 31
  • Mina the Hollower â€“ October 31

On Tuesday, during Gamescom Opening Night Live, I noticed a few games received October launch dates. I wondered to myself how many other games were arriving in that same month. Checking online, I discovered a giant list of October releases. This is one of the most jam-packed months Iâ€™ve seen in some time. Itâ€™s not just that a lot of games are arriving in a short window, but how varied the list is. We have big open-world AAA games, like Ghost of Yotei and, on Switch 2, Borderlands 4. But we also have smaller games like Ball X Pit and Moonlighter 2. Thereâ€™s a park builder courtesy of Jurassic World Evolution 3 and a massive online shooter in the form of Battlefield 6. New PokÃ©mon and Digimon games, a fresh Ninja Gaiden, a big Obsidian RPG, a creepy horror game, vampires, and even a fucking Christmas game. Heck, the new Double Fine game, Keeper, is out in October, and Iâ€™ve been waiting years for that studioâ€™s next project. Now itâ€™s coming, but sandwiched between, like, six other games I want to play.

Whatâ€™s going on here? Well, some of this is just normal video game industry stuff. Studios want to get their games out before the holiday shopping season. But I bet some of these games were holding off until they knew what Rockstar was planning with Grand Theft Auto 6. And once it became clear October and November wouldnâ€™t be dominated by GTA 6, as Rockstar delayed the open-world game to May 2026, some publishers and devs likely committed to launching in the spookiest month of the year.

Sure, maybe a few of these get delayed, but Iâ€™m not holding my breath. October isnâ€™t that far away, so Iâ€™d expect most of these games to be locked in and not budge to November or later. Thatâ€™s a scary thought as someone who works at a video game website. While Iâ€™m excited to have new stuff to play and write about, I wish it were a bit more spread out. Such is life. Good luck out there, folks, and remember: You canâ€™t play it all, so play what you can and enjoy the ride.



https://kotaku.com/oh-no-too-many-games-are-rushing-to-fill-the-gta-6-sized-hole-in-october-2000618856

item.title: Switch 2 Already Shaping Up For A Big 2026 With Starfield Also Reportedly Getting Ported
item.content:encoded:
Cyberpunk 2077 might not be the only massive sci-fi RPG on Switch 2 for long. Could Starfield get ported as well? Why is Dead Spaceâ€˜s old Creative Director all-in on AI? And How did an AI replica of a real content creator make its way onto the official First Descendent TikTok channel? Welcome to the latest edition of Morning Checkpoint, Kotakuâ€˜s brief daily roundup of gaming culture and news, where weâ€™re doing a bunch of clean-up from the first day of Gamescom 2025.

Podcaster NateTheHate, whoâ€™s quickly developed a reputation for accurate leaks around upcoming Nintendo announcements, now claims Bethesdaâ€™s open-world sci-fi RPG is coming to the companyâ€™s handheld hybrid next year. â€œIndiana Jones and the Great Circle wonâ€™t be the only Bethesda game coming to Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026,â€ he posted on X yesterday. â€œSee that planet? You can go there. Aside from landing on PS5â€¦Starfield is planned for release on Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026.â€ FromSoftwareâ€™s The Duskbloods has also been confirmed for Switch 2 in 2026, and Nintendo has yet to reveal any of its expected slate for the consoleâ€™s second year. Starfield is reportedly coming to PS5 next year as well, seemingly closer to whenever the second expansion launches.

The First Descendent blames TikTok for AI slop video

Nexonâ€™s free-to-play loot shooter, also known as â€œGooner Destiny,â€ accidentally shared an AI-generated ad on TikTok that ripped off another content creator. The publisher now says a TikTok marketing program automatically solicited the ad and linked it to The First Descendantsâ€™ account with no controls to verify copyright infringement or other content concerns. Sounds bad! â€œWe will also be committed to continuously being more transparent and responsible to regain the trust of our community and creators,â€ the company writes. â€œOnce again, we deeply apologize for the disappointment and inconvenience this incident has caused.â€

Final Fantasy 14 could be coming to Switch 2

Director Naoki Yoshida told VGC at Gamescom that Square Enix is in talks with Nintendo about porting the hit MMORPG over. â€œThe discussions have been positive, so I do hope that players will look forward to hopefully good news in the future,â€ he said. It sounds like Final Fantasy 16 isnâ€™t out of the question either. Yoshida added, â€œFor me, itâ€™s just my aim to provide Final Fantasy 14 and 16 to as many players as possible, and I hope that as many players as possible will be able to enjoy those two games.â€

The director of Callisto Protocol is going all-in on AI

Glen Schofield told The Game Industry â€œAI is going to be fantastic.â€ He said heâ€™s holding seminars about how AI can make creatives more efficient and thinks the technology will be an inevitable part of game development in 5-10 years, but heâ€™s not sure exactly how it will all shake out. â€œIs it going to be an engine?â€ he said. â€œRight now, itâ€™s a whole bunch of things that just kind of suck it inâ€¦ and into what? Itâ€™s going to have to settle down a bit before we actually use it.â€ Schofield also claimed Callisto Protocol sold over 5 million copies, but regretted not delaying it. He said AAA games are not dead and is looking for someone to pay him to make another.

High on Life 2 gets a release date

The sci-fi comedy shooter will arrive on PC and console, including on Game Pass, on February 13, 2026. Ralph Ineson, best known as Cid in FF16 and more recently Galactus in The Fantastic Four: First Steps, will be voicing the newest gun in the game.

Triangle Strategy shadow-drops on Xbox and PS5

The HD-2D homage to games like Final Fantasy Tactics was previously a Switch exclusive on console. Square Enixâ€™s port is now on Xbox with a starting discount of 30 percent off.

Stalker 2 comes to PS5 in November

The survival horror shooter makes the jump on November 20 as more former Xbox console exclusives get ported and help round-out Sonyâ€™s previously anemic 2025 release slate.

The biggest lines at Gamescom are for Silksong

THIS IS THE LINE OF HOLLOW KNIGHT SILKSONG ON PRESS DAY AT 9AM. #Gamescom pic.twitter.com/lNz1q62AZ5

â€” Daan K. ğŸ”œ Gamescom 2025 (@NintenDaan) August 20, 2025

The Hollow Knight sequel is getting a special announcement on August 21â€”a release date, hopefully?â€”but in the meantime, attendees at Gamescom are making the Silksong demos at the Nintendo and Xbox booths the highlights of the show so far. Nintendo Life already went hands-on and confirmed the Metroidvania Soulslike supports 120Hz refresh on Switch 2 in TV mode.

ICYMI:

  • Kirby Air Riders has a release date and looks refreshingly old-school
  • Rod Fergusson is trying to save BioShock a second time
  • This Japanese train game was the best thing revealed at Gamescom

Watch This:
